title: Chrome extension turns Brexit into Halloween - and Boris Johnson is Frankenstein
text:

With the current political climate, it’s hard to go more than a few minutes without a mention of Brexit popping up online.

If you’re sick of the whole thing, thankfully help is at hand in the form of a new Chrome extension, dubbed the ‘Brexit Blocker: Trick or Treaty.’

The extension replaces any mentions of Brexit with Halloween , while the protagonists of Parliament will be swapped for the heroes of Halloween, according to Mc&T, the creative agency behind it.

Any mentions of Boris Johnson will be swapped for Frankenstein, while Article 50 will be replaced with ‘Voodoo shrunken head.’

We tested the extension on a tweet by Mirror Politics, which originally read: " Jeremy Corbyn and Boris Johnson meet to discuss 'reasonable timetable' for Brexit Bill."

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Hilariously, the extension transformed this to: "The Frightened Wasp and Abominable Blowman meet to discuss 'reasonable timetable' for Halloween Hell."

Paul McEntee, CEO and founder of Mc&T, said: “Brexit escalation and Halloween happening inthe same societal climate is too good to miss.

“Our point with Brexit Blocker is that Brexit is slightly monotonous now, so with this new tool you can block it out and enjoy a bit more light-hearted fun with some of your favourite Halloween characters instead of those in Westminster.”

How to use the Brexit Blocker

If you’d rather see Halloween than Brexit, you can download the Brexit Blocker here.

It works as a Google Chrome extension, so will swap out any mentions of Brexit on that browser, whether you’re surfing the web, or scrolling through Twitter !

Happy browsing!
description: EXCLUSIVE: The extension replaces any mentions of Brexit with Halloween, while the protagonists of Parliament will be swapped for the heroes of Halloween
